title: What is Attestation? Countries that Accept Attested Documents
metaTitle: What is Attestation? Countries that Accept Attested Documents
metaDescription: Learn what document attestation means and which countries require it. Get reliable attestation services in Delhi for personal, educational, and commercial use.

content.text:
If you’re planning international travel, employment, education, or residency abroad—especially to countries like the UAE, Qatar, or Saudi Arabia—you’ve likely heard of document attestation. But what exactly is attestation, how does it differ from apostille, and which countries require it?

In this detailed guide by Pro Attestation Services, we explain everything you need to know about the attestation process in India, why it’s crucial, and which countries accept attested documents in 2025.

Document attestation is the process of certifying the authenticity of official documents—personal, educational, or commercial—by government authorities for international use. It is mandatory for countries not part of the Hague Apostille Convention.

items: The authenticity of the issuing institution
The identity of the document holder

content.text: This process ensures that your documents are accepted and recognized as valid by foreign embassies, ministries, and immigration departments.
Types of Documents That Require Attestation
Step-by-Step Process of Attestation in India
At Pro Attestation Services, we follow a structured, government-compliant attestation procedure:

items: Local verification by a certified notary public
Home Department or SDM (for personal docs)
Document legalized by the foreign embassy (e.g., UAE, Qatar, Kuwait) in India
Final attestation in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in the destination country (e.g., MOFA UAE)

content.text: This entire process typically takes 4–10 business days depending on document type and destination.
Countries That Require Attestation Instead of Apostille
Attestation is mandatory for countries that are not part of the Hague Convention of 1961. These include:
These countries require full attestation including MEA + Embassy + MOFA legalization.

items: Employment Visa Processing: Employers require attested degrees and PCC
Family or Dependent Visa: Marriage and birth certificates must be attested
Educational Admissions: For students applying to non-apostille countries
Business Setup: For registering companies or signing contracts abroad

content.text: Without attestation, your documents will not be accepted for visa processing or official transactions in these countries.

content.question: How long does apostille take in India?
Is apostille enough for UAE?
content.answer: No. UAE is not a Hague Convention country. You need full attestation including UAE Embassy and MOFA.

content.question: Do apostille documents expire?
content.answer: Yes. Most countries accept apostille within 6–12 months, but check with your specific institution.
